text:
- [Narrator] This is not
an adventure playground.
It's actually the offices of King,

one of the world's
largest gaming companies.
And we're here to look around.
Stockholm is home to the world's
most innovative gaming companies
such as Mojang, EA DICE,

and the company that we've
come here to see, King.
You may not have heard of the company,

but you've most certainly
heard of its games.

Candy Crush, Farm Heroes, Pet
Rescue, and over 200 others.
And gaming is big business here.
It has 262 million monthly users --
that's more than Twitter gets.

Its games are played in
all seven continents,
with over 1.1 trillion game rounds played.
King has two offices in Stockholm,
claiming to be filled

with some incredible
architecture and design.
But is it really that amazing inside?

The first, Apelbergsgatan,
hosts a cavernous indoor forest
as a breakout space.
This 33,000 square-foot room

features silhouettes
of woodland creatures,
hanging basket chairs, and bean bags.

There's an interactive
floor featuring a stream,

which freezes and thaws in
a preset seasonal rotation.

The second office is across
the street at Sveav√§gen 44.
- The whole theme here is based
on like a Swedish amusement park,

something that you would find
in a smaller Swedish city.

These tables especially
spins around like carousels.

- [Narrator] On the first
floor is Pavilion Park,
which has rooms filled with board games,
craft stations, and the biggest collection
of game controllers we've ever seen.
The company's fun and funky decor
is down to its Swedish work ethic.
[Marcus] It's very important for us
to make teams work well together.
So, the office, as you will find,

there's a lot of spaces where
a team can, with short notice,

get together and find somewhere
quiet to work together.
We like flat organizations,

which can from the
outside seem a bit chaotic

because it can be hard to
understand who really decides.
I think that's a downside with it
because we like a lot of people
to be involved in when we take decisions,
but I think the upside is engagement.

A lot of people feel
that they're bought in
to what we're doing.

- [Narrator] So, how are
games actually made here?
- [Namie] What I want to show you is how
to create a brand new level.

And what we do here is to
hide animals under icing,
or ice as we call it,

and then we place out
the animals like this.

What the characters in
the Friends [Saga] do
is that when you gather their color,
you fill up this barometer and then,

when I have collected 10
red candies for example,
she will get her fish.

- [Narrator] If you play Candy
Crush or other King games,

you might not realize each
character voice and music sample

is created here in
specially designed studios.

- So, we record all the
music for Candy Friends
in New York with real live musicians.

Once I'm done, I hand it
over to an orchestrator
who then makes sure

that it's actually
playable for the musicians.
- [Narrator] We even had a stab
at voicing Mr. Yeti from the Friends Saga.
- [Charlie] Hey there! Hello.
Hellooooo.
- [Narrator] On the upper floors,
there's more breakout spaces
and rooms dedicated to arcade games.
The library has hundreds of books
from cooking, to building websites.
[Marcus] Really what we need to do
is we need to bring people together
with a different background
and different skillsets. Hence
that's why we have a football table
with a more diverse cast
than what you otherwise would find.
- [Narrator] So, that's it for our tour.

Would you want to work
in an office like this?
Or would it be all a bit too much?
Let us know in the comments.
